Start New Run? Yes No Previous Delivery Edit Order Minutes since order/Address\n Choose Yes to if you are returning to the store and the undelivered orders are part of the next run. Choose no if you are just organizing the deliveries.

Apartment Number Send Feedback Contact developer to report a problem, or suggest an improvement. Feedback Review This App If you like this app, let people know. Review Mileage and Hourly pay Mileage Pay Set the amount you earn by delivery, by odometer, or as a % of total. Mileage pay per delivery The amount of money you get paid for each delivery by the store Dollar amount you get paid for each delivery Pay as percentage of total The percent of the order total you get paid by the store Percent of order total you get paid Pay per mile on odometer The dollars per mile that you earn. This will trigger the odometer reading pop up Amount of money you get paid per mile Mileage pay for each run The amount of money you get paid for each time you leave the store. Dollar amount you get paid for each run Alt. Mileage pay (out of town) The amount of money you get paid for out of town delivery by the store Dollar amount you get paid for out of town deliveries Alt. Mileage pay 2 Alt. Mileage pay 3 Alt. Mileage pay 4 An alternate amount you get paid for each delivery in the Alt2 category Dollar amount you get paid for the alt 2 categories of deliveries Alt. Mileage pay label The label used for Alternate Mileage pay The label used for Alternate Mileage pay, such as Out Of Town. The label used for Alternate Mileage pay time date Delivery time Order placed #00000000 #000080 Quit Go Back Undelivered EBT Help The alternate mileage pay is for situations where the store pays you a different amount for the delivery than it normally would. The value of the alternate mileage pay is added to your normal mileage pay.\nFor example if you get payed $0.10 per delivery, but you get paid $0.15 per delivery to the local Army Base. You would set one Alt. Mileage Pay to $0.05 and the Alt. Mileage pay label to Army Base.\nIf there are some deliveries which you do not get paid mileage for you can enter a negative number, so if you get $0.10 a delivery enter an alternate amount of -0.10, then select that one when you don\'t get mileage pay. There are 4 alternate amounts in case you have different pay for Out Of Town, College Dorm, Army Base, Before 4pm, or whatever.

Initial Order Number Set automatically when entering order numbers. Serves as the first number in the list of order numbers
The order number to start counting from Address Quick Entry Screen Show a separate address input screen when entering new orders. Store Address The street address of the store where the deliveries originate. Setting this field will enable the navigate to store button

Work week starts on Add Delivery Settings Set up which of the new order quick input screens are shown and how the address suggestions are generated
Delivery Droid tries to make entering orders as quick as possible. To do this there are several screens dedicated to entering order numbers, order prices, and order addresses. Here you can configure the order entry process to skip some of those screens or configure how they work.
Settings New Shift Tip History Past Orders Banks Tills & Drops Hourly pay rate The amount of money you get paid per hour by the store" Hourly pay rate you get paid while at work Pay rate while on a run The hourly rate (if different) you get paid while on a run average\ntip this\naddress Tips Made Best Tip Average Tip Worst Tip text message
Delivery Droid Tip Information Email: Bank Amount Total You Owe Total Your Owed Drops Clear Values Total They owe You owe start end Deliveries Shift start Shift end Odometer value at start of shift Odometer value at end of shift End this shift Remove this shift Odometer and Hours Delete shift Go to day Show Notes Miles Driven Hours worked Delete this record? Money Collected Odometer total Credits Many thanks to the delivery drivers who have contributed to the design\n\nThis app was inspired by:\nMatt Henry\n\n Since then many drivers have contributed:\nNeil Sizemore\nMichael Barron Jr\nEssohlath Akadje\nSteven Poekert\nLes Prince\nCarlton Clay\nChris Garcia\nSarah Sutton\nFoum Recei\nAl Dolega\nJoshua McBride\nJason Soltan\nTyler Allen\nManuel Villa\nRobert Royce\nJoseph Ford\n
Delivery Zip Codes Delivery Droid can download a list of street names by zip code for fast address input
New Zip Code Enter a zip code in which deliveries are made to set up areas to download the street names for.
Delivery Center Latitude Delivery droid will use the center longitude and latitude for address validation.
Delivery Center Longitude Delivery droid will use the center longitude and longitude for address validation.
Delivery Droid can download street names by zip code so that you can scroll through a list of streets instead of typing in the street name. This settings screen is where you can configure the zip codes in your delivery area.\nUnfortunatly this only works for our users in the USA.
Map Notes Backup & Restore Data Help on Backup & Restore Delivery Droid stores all your order and shift data in an SQL database file. By default the file is stored on your phones main memory along with the app.\n\nSelecting Backup Data will let you make a copy of the file and store it on your sd-card.\n\nKeep data on sdcard moves the database file to the sd-card and begins using it there instead of on the phones main app memory. After selecting this option you are free to manipulate the SQL file with any standard SQLite file tool.\n\nSelecting Import database backup will take the contents of a previously created backup file and import those records in to the active database. You must be careful not to import the same data more than 1 time or else you will have duplicate entries.\n\nSelect Use database backup to replace the contents of your current database with a previous backup. Warning this will delete everything in your active database, make sure you have made a backup of your active data first.
If data is imported 2 times you will have duplicate data. Are you sure you want to import this data?
Warning, This will ERASE your current database and replace it the new data. Are you sure you want to start using this new data?
Download Street List Download a street list for these zip codes to be used in address entry Advanced When entering addresses, these GPS values are used to help limit suggestions to ones in your area.

Dual wage Check if you get paid a different wage while you are on the road. On road hourly rate Enter the rate you get paid while on route. Delivery droid keeps all of its order and shift data a database called DeliveryData.SQLite. You can upload a copy your data to Google Drive for backup
Copy Database To Google Drive Restore Database From Google Drive
Be careful with the restore option as it will replace your current data with the backup on google drive thereby deleting whats currently on the phone.
Edit Order Previous Order Call Store Custom Value Name The first time you click a custom pay amount toggle, this setup popup will appear.
Next time you click on this toggle it will toggle the amount on or off
Set custom reimbursement amount for this delivery
Where database is stored If you select the option below your data will be stored on yours phones external storage where other apps can access the file and its easy for you to find for backup.
The default unchecked setting means the database is stored on a special part of your phone only the delivery droid application cal access. This provides the best privacy and security but also makes it hardest to properly back up your database file and file managers will also not be able to find it and you won\'t be able to email it.\nBy selecting keep data on external storage the data will be easily accessible if you want to copy it to your computer or email it to yourself
